name: v2.0.0
body:
* Added initial support for Bluetooth beacons (#6).
* Fixed that battery messages where being sent via mobile regardless of settings.

name: v1.7.1
body: Fix crash due to class missing. Seems proguard became more strict in which files to keep on its own.

name: v1.7.0
body:
Updated the app to fully support Android 10 (fixing #17)
• The Content tab has been renamed to Conditions and allows both adding networks and configuring their message.
• In addition to adding known networks, it is now possible to enter network names manually.
• The presence topic can now be found in the Schedule tab.

name: v1.6.6
body:
* Fixed a NullPointerException (#16).
* Added some documentation for client certificate authentication (#15).
* Added uncaught exception handler to capture the crash stack trace within the log.

name: v1.6.5
body:
* Re-enable schedule periods down to 1 minute (#13)
* Only allow connection check when hostname is present (#12)
* Small UX improvements

name: v1.6.4
body: Next attempt to fix F-Droid build.

name: v1.6.3
body: Yet again, only build script changes. Hopefully, this will fix the F-Droid build.

name: v1.6.2
body: Minor build script changes.

name: v1.6.1
body: Minor bugfix related to handling of VPN connections.

name: v1.6.0
body:
new features:
* option to send offline messages while connected to mobile network
* option to send battery level to a separate topic (see #10)
* on Android 6+, encrypt login password
* migrate from foreground service with scheduled thread pool to Android alarm manager and request disabling battery optimization
    * this should make sending messages more reliable during standby

name: v1.5.3
body: No new features this time, just including a statement about used components and their licenses.

name: v1.5.2
body: New minor feature: added a log view to the app to be better able to track some strange misbehavior

name: v1.5.1
body:
* minor glitch in v1.5 fixed: app no longer tries to connect to MQTT server when no message needs to be sent
* also adapted version info in manifest (forgot to do so for v1.4.2 and v1.5)

name: v1.5
body:
Finally now more than WiFi network can be selected, and each for network a specific message can be configured. The default behavior (sending "online" for every network) stays the same.

This release also includes the fix to #9, thanks again to @Albadon.

name: v1.4.2
body: fix issue #8 (and hopefully #4 too) with Android 9 not recognizing WiFi names (thanks to @Albadon)

name: v1.4.1
body: small UI bugfix: value of time period slider had gone missing, re-enabling it

name: v1.4
body:
new features (thanks to @pavel-gololobov):
* add support for username / password authentication
* add toggle to also send "offline" messages when target WiFi is not connected

name: v1.3.3
body: * regression: disable re-alerting when updating notification

name: v1.3.2
body:
* make sure notifications are updated properly
* automatically re-start scheduling in case of unexpected errors

name: v1.3.1
body: * fixed an issue where the network connectivity changing while trying to publish triggered an NPE

name: v1.3
body:
* properly support TLS by using Android CA trust store
* support client certificate authentication
* german translation

name: v1.2
body:
general UI improvements

- show last / next pings in notification
- split preferences in connection and scheduling tabs
- add connection check functionality
- make wifi name selectable from known networks

NOTE: when migrating from earlier versions, you will need to re-configure your MQTT broker

name: v1.1.1
body: no code changes, only downgrading gradle wrapper

name: v1.1
body:
* Android 9 and higher: also ask user to enable location service, otherwise getting wifi name will not work
* Android 8.1 and lower: remove unnecessary request for location permission

name: v1.0
body: Initial release
